summary: Winkler County is a county in the state of Texas in the United States.
full_text:
Winkler County is a county located in the U.S. state of Texas. As of the 2010 census, its population was 7,110. Its county seat is Kermit. The county was created in 1887 and organized in 1910. It is named for Clinton M. Winkler, a Colonel in the Confederate Army.
Part of the large Haley Ranch, founded by the father of Texas historian J. Evetts Haley, is in Winkler County, with another portion in neighboring Loving County.
title: Winkler County, Texas
